WARNING: Patience required!

The most annoying thing about this game is the amount of time it takes to match you in a session, as a solo survivor, anywhere from 10 to 12 minutes. As a killer its not as slow but still slow. The matching is faster during off hours -- early on weekday mornings. This tells me that its an issue with their matching server being overwhelmed and not properly sized to handle the load.

Other than that, the game is pretty fun (when you get to play).
Its a really fun game, I play on a old laptop that con not run much but at the lowest settings it is still very fun to play
Can't even learn to play, too many legions or nurses hitting me through walls and pallets. Do. Not. Buy.

This game is alright. Keys needs to be reworked. If there is a key in the game there is no way to get rid of it unless the survivor has a ward and you sac them. Would be a little nicer if the key disappears if the person who brought it in gets sac'd. I usually play survivor, but sometimes I play killer. If you want to have a good time play survivor. If you want to hate the game play killer.

The game isn't properly balanced, no game really is, but this one especially. I don't have the qualifications to talk about how to properly balance a game. But plenty of content creators who have played this game for thousands of hours do not believe this game is balanced on either side. The developers, from what I have heard from those creators, should work on fixing issues with the core gameplay, then tweaking individual killers and the survivor gameplay, then adding new chapters. This in combination with my 424 (at the time of this being posted) hours in the game, lead to my negative review.

Edit: Dev's upped the price... yaaaaay...

This is one of them games you will enjoy and hate at the same time. 

The game could have been executed a lot better if the developers did do something about the bugs which have been around for 1 - 2 years and have things balanced. Not to mention only just adding colour blind mode after 5 years of the games release just cause they was being called out from Steven Spohn after hearing a developer who is "Getting bored" of people "blabbing about colorblind mode"

Game-play : 1 Killer with a Unique set of abilities vs 4 Survivors which have the option of 5 tools they can use within the trial.
5 Generators need to be completed to unlock the exit gates, the killer has to counter the survivors job and has to torture them through 3 health states before hooking them. In total the Survivor has 9 health states (If they get hooked 3 times ) and the killer can not be defeated, only way to counter the killer is either looping them correct, using pallets and windows to escape from them or certain perks which prevent him from carrying you to your death. Their is no MMR in this game which will make newer players despise this game.

Community : Here is my experience from this game. The community is toxic, you will get Killer Mains and Survivor Mains complaining about things which should have happened or which shouldn't have happened and with seeing how development is going, the dev's are listening to killer mains more and making this game less fun for survivors. I play both sides and i see the issues for both of them.

Killers : Can fairly be countered but with each new chapter they are adding they are creating another killer with its own set of problems which will surely get survivors to complain.
They tend to get treated well with additional licensed Chapters such as Ghost face and Silent Hill. 
My problem is that more killers are getting built in exposed effects and mori's. Something which removes about 3 health states depending on your game. 
Also this is depending on the player you will have a slight possibility of being camped whilst being on hook, only way to counter is by sticking on that hook and making sure your fellow survivors are doing their job, completing generators.

Survivors : Survivors are limited with what they can do but if pulled off it can benefit them massively. Looping killers can buy you time for fellow team mates to complete gens. Survivors can stack up to 3 other friends and with good coordination they can out play the killer and survive. Though playing against SWF [4 stack of friends] will be very difficult with the killer and can lead to them using toxic strat's against you.

Maps : They are currently being changed which is removing alot of loops for survivors run about with the killer and creating alot of deadzones, this is mostly aiding the killer. 
Each map has a unique look and they are all well made in design, though they can be sided.

I would recommend it if you can ignore some things and stick a few hours in to understanding on what you should be doing

péssimo

Overall I say this is a pretty fun game to play. If you're playing on your own I recommend playing killer and hunting down survivors. Be warned this game is a lot easier for survivors to win instead of killer even if it does not seem that way when you first start out. A good team of survivors can rush the game play and finish their objective faster than you so do not get too upset if at least one survivor gets away. Just try to be a good sport and have fun.

However at some point I recommend playing survivor after getting familiar with the maps as killer either on your own or with a team of friends (team is extremely easier). Simple tips, do not stay still for too long, crouch killers have a harder time seeing you then you do seeing them, do not sprint if you are trying to hide sprinting lets killers see your scratch marks.

Lastly if you are new with the game, it can be laggy on occasions and some things just need fixed with updates. In my experience it's not that bad. Play the tutorial when you open the game I believe it's in options (gives you a lot of points to start you off in game per tutorial) and be friendly to your local killer after match they tried their best.

I have been playing this game on and off for a little while now and this game is definitely more fun when you are playing with friends! I do play the game solo and depending on your teammates the game can be super fun. I personally think the games achievements are super fun to hunt for. The game can be a big grind but I do feel the game rewards you for playing the game whether it be with the iridescent shards you get for leveling or the archives free rewards.
